intro: Chaetothylax tocantinus, commonly known as the Tocantins thistle, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually spiny and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
